n_samples = 1000
for distribution_type in [ 'Uniform', 'Poisson', 'Normal', 'Pareto']:
    for n in [3,10,100]:
        fig = plt.figure(figsize = (25,10));  c = 0
        if distribution_type == 'Uniform':
            X = np.random.randint(0,50, size = (n_samples,n) )
            plt.suptitle('Uniform integers till 50. '+str(n)+' columns. '+str(n_samples) +' Points', fontsize = 20) 
        elif distribution_type == 'Poisson':
            X = np.random.poisson(5, size = (n_samples,n) )# 10000)
            plt.suptitle('Poisson distribution. Lambda= 5. '+str(n)+' columns. '+str(n_samples) +' Points', fontsize = 20) 
        elif distribution_type == 'Normal':
            X = np.random.normal(0,1, size = (n_samples,n) )# 10000)
            plt.suptitle('Standard normal distribution.'+str(n)+' columns. '+str(n_samples) +' Points', fontsize = 20) 
        elif distribution_type == 'Pareto':
            #  (np.random.pareto(a, 1000) + 1) * m
            X = (np.random.pareto(3, size = (n_samples,n) ) +1) * 2 # 10000)
            plt.suptitle('Pareto distribution.'+str(n)+' columns. '+str(n_samples) +' Points', fontsize = 20) 
            
        n_x_subplots = 2

        c+=1; fig.add_subplot(1,n_x_subplots,c);
        plt.scatter(X[:,0],X[:,1])
        plt.title('Without normalization', fontsize = 20)
        c+=1; fig.add_subplot(1,n_x_subplots,c);
        v = X.sum(axis = 1)
        X2 = X / v[:,None]
        plt.scatter(X2[:,0],X2[:,1])
        plt.title('After normalization each row to 1', fontsize = 20)

        plt.show()
